bioghist.p: Henry Edward Crampton (1875-1956) devoted most of his career to the study of the land snail genus Partula. He made 12 expeditions to the Pacific islands (spending most of his time on Tahiti, Moorea, and surrounding islands) and published three monographs on the evolution, distribution, and variation of Partula.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional papers of Henry Edward Crampton. Materials in the collection include: research data and field notes; typed and handwritten drafts of articles; galley proofs; reprints; correspondence; photographs and negatives; maps (some hand drawn); shell specimens; and printing blocks. There are also original data and manuscripts relating to land snails of Tahiti, including morphometric measurements and statistical analyses.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
